revised_title: Effects of Dust on Blast Waves: A Numerical Study
tldr: This study investigates the effects of dust on blast waves using the random choice method. The authors analyze three cases of spherical blast waves propagating into a dusty medium with different dust distributions. They find that the presence of dust weakens the blast wave, reducing the gas velocity, temperature, and pressure behind the blast-wave front. The dust also changes the shape of the blast-wave pressure signature and creates a bell-shaped pattern in the dust spatial-density distribution.
